radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver echotexture and echogenicity are normal. The portal vein is patent and shows normal hepatopetal flow. The common bile duct measures 6 mm. The gallbladder is slightly distended with mild-to-moderate gallbladder wall thickening without pericholecystic fluid. Multiple small stones are seen layering in the dependent portion of the gallbladder. The right kidney measures 9.7 cm and is normal in appearance. The left kidney measures 10.6 cm and is normal appearing. The spleen measures 10.1 cm. The visualized abdominal aorta is normal in caliber. The visualized portion of the IVC is unremarkable. There is no evidence of ascites.
